title: 'It's a deadly combination': Why the Tkachuk-Bennett-Verhaeghe line is so dominant
content: They could be the top-scoring trio on any team. Or a team's checking line. Or its most annoying pests.

title: Car drives into crowd at Liverpool title parade
content: A 53-year-old man has been arrested after a car collided with pedestrians in Liverpool city centre during Liverpool Football Club's Premier League victory parade.

title: Vandy No. 1 baseball seed; 13 SEC teams in field
content: A record 13 SEC teams have been named to the 64-team field for the NCAA baseball tournament, with Vanderbilt being awarded the overall No. 1 seed.

title: Sources: Pacers allow Haliburton's dad into games
content: Tyrese Haliburton's dad, John, will be allowed to attend Pacers home games in a suite, beginning with Game 4 against the Knicks on Tuesday, sources told ESPN.

title: Indy 500 runner-up Ericsson penalized to 31st
content: Indianapolis 500 runner-up Marcus Ericsson was penalized to the rear of the 33-car field along with Andretti Global teammate Kyle Kirkwood after their cars were found to have unapproved modifications in the postrace inspection.

title: Panthers without Reinhart, Mikkola, Greer for G4
content: The Panthers will be without a trio of injured players -- Sam Reinhart, Niko Mikkola and A.J. Greer -- for Game 4 of the Eastern Conference finals on Monday night, as they look to sweep the Hurricanes and advance to their third straight Stanley Cup Final.

title: U.S. wins 1st worlds in 92 years, honors Gaudreau
content: Buffalo Sabres forward Tage Thompson scored 2:02 into overtime, and Team USA outlasted Switzerland 1-0 in the final of the ice hockey world championship Sunday, the first American title in this tournament in 92 years after winning it in 1933.

title: Free 'Merci Rafa' T-shirts spark resale frenzy
content: A day after the French Open honored Rafael Nadal on court, dozens of spectators began selling the clay-colored "Merci Rafa" T-shirts handed out at Sunday's tribute -- with some listings reaching up to $540.

title: üèà Ranking college football coaches as players
content: There are small-school studs and a Heisman winner. There's a national title QB and one of the best ever.

title: NBA free agent rankings: Kevin Pelton's top 25 for 2025
content: Will LeBron James opt in or sign a new deal? Can Indy keep Myles Turner? We're breaking down what's next for 25 star free agents.

title: Memorial Day MLB standings check: Playoff field predictions, biggest surprises and more
content: Our experts look at the best and worst of the season to date -- and predict which teams will rule from here on out.

title: 'I know you're in hell right now': What it's like inside Lu Dort's impossible 'Dorture Chamber'
content: One play six years ago introduced one of the league's most dominant defenders -- and he has been exhausting NBA superstars ever since.

title: The decline of a dynasty: The Patriots had a 'difficult' two seasons. Can Mike Vrabel reignite them?Ôªø
content: The Patriots have revamped their front office, coaching personnel and roster after back-to-back 4-13 seasons in hopes of closing the gap in the AFC East.

title: Caitlin Clark injury reaction: What's next for Indiana Fever star
content: The Indiana Fever announced Clark will miss at least two weeks with a quad strain. What's next for Clark and her team?

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Knicks steal Game 3 behind Towns‚Äô 4th-quarter surge
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western Conference finals.

title: How Xabi Alonso made his rapid rise from rookie coach to Real Madrid
content: Less than three years into his career as a top-level coach, Alonso is returning to Real Madrid, the most pressurized job in football. He's earned it.

title: Two iconic races, one day: McLaren's quest to win Monaco, Indy 500
content: On Sunday, McLaren tried to win two races 4,500 miles apart: F1's Monaco GP and IndyCar's Indianapolis 500.

title: Maiden Indy 500 win completes Palou's domination of IndyCar
content: After three titles and 15 wins, √Ålex Palou felt incomplete. Now an Indy 500 winner, that's no longer the case.

title: Premier League 2024-25 awards: From best game to worst signing
content: Bill Connelly takes a look at the numbers and gives out his awards to the best and worst performers of the 2024-25 Premier League season.

title: Barcelona sneak into Pot 1 for UCL draw again
content: Barcelona will be in Pot 1 of seeds for the league phase draw of the 2025-26 UEFA Champions League (UCL), and for the second successive season it's because Roma missed out on the final day.

title: Ten Hag succeeds Alonso as Leverkusen boss
content: Former Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag has been confirmed as the new manager of Bundesliga side Bayer Leverkusen, replacing Xabi Alonso.

title: Aston Villa file complaint after costly ref 'mistake'
content: Aston Villa confirmed they have made a complaint to the PGMOL about the selection of "inexperienced" referee Thomas Bramall after a costly decision to rule out a Morgan Rogers' goal.

title: Mac Allister brothers lift league titles on same day
content: Argentina's Mac Allister brothers Alexis and Kevin pulled off an unusual family feat on Sunday by lifting championship trophies on the same afternoon in different countries.

title: Salah: Saudi Pro League talks were 'serious'
content: Mohamed Salahvsaid that his talks with Saudi Pro League officials were serious even though he eventually renewed his Liverpool contract.

title: Alonso plans to make Madrid 'unstoppable force'
content: Xabi Alonso said he hopes to make Real Madrid an "unstoppable force" in his presentation as the club's new coach, while thanking Carlo Ancelotti.

title: Pep hints at Grealish exit after squad omission
content: Guardiola has suggested that Grealish may have to leave City after the forward was omitted from the squad for the 2-0 win over Fulham.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: San Diego Wave starting to look formidable
content: San Diego are undefeated in six games and don't seem to be slowing down anytime soon. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: It's Good Guy vs. Bad Guy on Season 33 of 'The Ultimate Fighter'
content: UFC Hall of Famers Daniel Cormier and Chael Sonnen break down what to expect from this season of TUF.

title: Waiver wire: Three hitters to add power to your infield
content: Todd Zola outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and lineup tips for your fantasy roster.

title: Emerging Valkyries pickups to stream
content: Veronica Burton and Kayla Thornton highlight some of the top fantasy women's basketball streamers for the week of May 26.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye move for Leipzig's ≈†e≈°ko
content: Arsenal are interested in signing RB Leipzig's Benjamin ≈†e≈°ko. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: "Consensual Relationship Turning Sour...": Top Court Cancels Rape Case
content: A consensual relationship turning sour or partners becoming distant cannot be a ground for invoking criminal machinery and such conduct "not only burdens the courts but also blots the identity of accused", the Supreme Court said.

title: Engineer's Body Was Found In Lake, Now CBI Will Probe His Mystery Death
content: An engineer with Himachal Pradesh Power Corporation went missing from Shimla on March 10. Eight days later, Vimal Negi's body was found under mysterious circumstances in a lake in Bilaspur district on March 18.

title: Video: 3 Men Made To Sit On Andhra Highway As Cops Hit Them With Sticks
content: Three men, with their legs at full stretch, are made to sit in the middle of the road on Tenali highway in Andhra Pradesh. Scores of policemen surround them. The cops beat them up publicly to teach the men a lesson.

title: Rape Victim's Intestines Had Come Out After Assault: Madhya Pradesh Police
content: One of the accused arrested for the gangrape of a tribal woman allegedly put his hand inside her body after the assault following which her intestines came out and she died of excessive bleeding in Khandwa district of Madhya Pradesh, police said.

title: Collegium Recommends 2 High Court Chief Justices For Top Court Elevation
content: The Supreme Court collegium on Monday recommended the appointments of Karnataka High Court Chief Justice N V Anjaria, Gauhati High Court Chief Justice Vijay Bishnoi, and Bombay High Court judge Justice A S Chandurkar as judges of the top court.

title: "Have Been Asked To Be Guest Lecturer In Berkeley": Smriti Irani To NDTV
content: Union minister Smriti Irani, who visited Amethi today for the first time since the Lok Sabha election, shared that she has been asked to be a guest lecturer at University of California, Berkeley.

title: 4-Year-Old Girl Dies In Accident During Traffic Police Checking In Karnataka
content: A four-year-old girl died in a road mishap on Monday during a traffic police check sparking a public outrage.

title: Had Balasaheb Thackeray Been Alive He Would've Hugged PM Modi For Op Sindoor: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said on Monday that had Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray been alive, he would have hugged Prime Minister Narendra Modi for the success of Operation Sindoor.

title: Delhi Man Caught For Creating Fake Profile To Defame Ex-Girlfriend: Cops
content: A 21-year-old man was apprehended in Delhi for allegedly creating a fake social media account in the name of his ex-girlfriend to defame her, police said on Monday.

title: 'Just Joking': Macron Denies Dispute With Wife After Viral Aircraft Video
content: French President Emmanuel Macron denied Monday having a domestic dispute with his wife Brigitte after a video appeared to show her shoving his face away when they touched down for a visit to Vietnam, blaming disinformation campaigns.

title: Woman Killed, Jewellery, Cash For Daughter's Wedding Stolen In Bengaluru
content: A woman was murdered, and gold jewellery and cash worth Rs 2 lakh and a mobile phone, which she kept for her daughter's wedding, were robbed from her home in Bengaluru this morning.

title: "Hand Of Kremlin?" Russian Foreign Ministry Mocks Macron's Aircraft Video
content: Russia's foreign ministry spokeswoman on Monday mocked a video of French President Emmanuel Macron and his wife Brigitte Macron getting off a plane, which has gone viral on social media overnight.

title: Top Officer Told To Monitor Liberian Shipwreck Every 2 Hours: Minister
content: The Directorate General of Shipping has been directed to monitor the situation arising out of the capsizing and sinking of a Liberian cargo ship off the Kerala coast, at every two hours, Union Shipping Minister Sarbananda Sonowal said on Monday.

title: 413 Drone Attacks On Rajasthan During Op Sindoor, All Neutralised: BSF
content: Pakistan carried out 413 drone attacks in Barmer, Jaisalmer, Bikaner, and Sri Ganganagar districts, but all of them were neutralised mid-air by India's air defence system, Border Security Force Inspector General (Rajasthan Frontier) ML Garg said.

title: Watch: Kilauea Volcano Spews 'Lava Fountain' 1,000 Feet Above Hawaii
content: One of the world's most active volcanoes spewed columns of lava exceeding 1,000 feet above Hawaii, according to US vulcanologists and spectacular footage released Sunday.

title: "Not Like We Will Die...": Iran's Pushback As US Tightens Grip On Nuclear Talks
content: As the fifth round of nuclear talks with the United States concluded over the weekend, Iran has declared that it is capable to survive even if the negotiations fails - an option that is non-existent from Donald Trump's perspective.

title: "Live In Peace, Eat Your Bread Or Else...": PM Modi's "Bullet" Message To Pak
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi issued a warning to Pakistan today, reaching out directly to its people. Only the people of Pakistan, he said, can cure it of the disease of terrorism.

title: India To Become 4th Largest Economy By End Of 2025: NITI Aayog Member
content: NITI Aayog member Arvind Virmani on Monday said India is set to become the fourth-largest economy in the world by the end of 2025, an assertion which came days after NITI CEO BVR Subrahmanyam claimed India has already overtaken Japan to reach.

title: Kolkata Metro Passengers To Be Fined For Crossing 'Yellow Line' On Platforms
content: The Kolkata Metro on Monday said it will fine people who unnecessarily cross the 'yellow' safety line on platforms of the Dakshineswar-New Garia corridor from June 1.

title: Madness or method: Trump says Putin's gone absolutely CRAZY' - is he right?
content: Donald Trump says Vladimir Putin has gone crazy. Moscow launched a massive aerial attack on Ukraine. The attack killed many civilians. Trump also criticized Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Kremlin suggests Trump's comment is due to emotional strain. Analysts debate if Putin is truly losing his mind. Or if he is following a strategic logic. Europe worries about Russia's ties with China.

title: Explained in charts: India to be 4th largest economy soon. How will it get to No.3 spot?
content: To become the world‚Äôs fourth largest economy is no mean feat - India has gone from being the 10th largest in 2014 to 4th largest in 11 years under the Modi government. Its Gross Domestic Product or GDP has more than doubled in this time frame. But, India's per capita GDP remains abysmally low.

title: With Rs 44,000 crore, India to revive minesweepers plan amid China threat
content: India is set to bolster its naval capabilities with the revival of a project to indigenously construct 12 advanced minesweepers. These Mine Countermeasure Vessels (MCMVs), costing approximately Rs 44,000 crore, are crucial for detecting and neutralizing underwater mines, addressing a critical gap in India's maritime defense.

title: Gaurav Gogoi vs Himanta Sarma? Congress sets stage for 2026 Assam battle
content: The Congress party has appointed Gaurav Gogoi as the president of the Assam Congress, setting the stage for a high-stakes political battle against BJP chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma in the upcoming assembly elections. This decision comes amidst allegations from Sarma regarding Gogoi's wife's alleged connections to Pakistan's ISI, which the Congress dismisses as baseless attacks.

title: IPL: Punjab Kings book top-two berth, Mumbai Indians left to fight in Eliminator
content: Punjab Kings defeated Mumbai Indians in a crucial match, securing a top-two finish in IPL 2025. Mumbai Indians scored 184/7, highlighted by Suryakumar Yadav's 57. Punjab Kings chased the target in 18.3 overs, powered by Priyansh Arya and Josh Inglis's partnership. Punjab Kings will now play in Qualifier 1, while Mumbai Indians will compete in the Eliminator.

title: Trump to Apple: Okay, you go to India but you're not going to sell in America without ...
content: President Trump is pushing Apple to manufacture iPhones in the United States, threatening a 25% tariff on imported products if they continue production in India. Trump expressed his desire for Apple to prioritize domestic manufacturing, even though India has offered tariff-free deals.

title: Army releases first-ever photos of Tri-services chiefs monitoring Op Sindoor
content: The Indian Army revealed a photo from Operation Sindoor. The operation targeted terror camps in Pakistan and PoJK. Top military officials monitored the strikes. Nine terror hideouts were hit. The operation followed the Pahalgam attack. PM Modi emphasized civil defence preparedness. S Jaishankar discussed cross-border terrorism. India deployed delegations to convey its stance. Most countries supported India's action.

title: Suryakumar Yadav breaks Sachin Tendulkar record
content: Suryakumar Yadav's impressive 57 and Hardik Pandya's contribution propelled Mumbai Indians to a total of 184 for seven against Punjab Kings in a crucial IPL match. Suryakumar surpassed Sachin Tendulkar's record, becoming Mumbai's highest run-scorer in a single IPL season.

title: Mark Cuban on why he does not drive his Tesla, but much cheaper Kia EV6
content: Mark Cuban prefers his Kia EV6 over his Tesla, citing user-friendliness, particularly the traditional turn signal design. Despite his preference, Cuban's teenage son isn't impressed, labeling the Kia a "nerd car." Cuban, a known critic of Elon Musk, has also playfully admitted to provoking Musk due to his perceived sensitivity.

title: 'Balasaheb would've hugged Modi': Shah flays Uddhav for 'baraat' dig
content: Amit Shah strongly criticized Uddhav Thackeray's remarks about the all-party delegations, defending Operation Sindoor and asserting Balasaheb Thackeray would have supported PM Modi's actions. Shah emphasized the operation's success in sending a strong message to Pakistan and the world regarding India's resolve to protect its borders and citizens, highlighting the swift retaliation following terror attacks.

title: 'Sukh chain ki zindagi jiyo, warna ...': PM's stern message to Pak
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing Pakistan from Bhuj, asserted that peace is a choice, but continued terrorism will be met with decisive retaliation following Operation Sindoor. He urged the people of Pakistan to eradicate terrorism for a peaceful existence, highlighting India's zero-tolerance stance. Modi also inaugurated development projects in Bhuj, praising the region's resilience and growth.

title: 'Working with govt': B'desh army tries to muzzle rumours of rift, Yunus exit
content: Amidst swirling rumors of discord, the Army Headquarters has firmly denied any rift with the Yunus government, emphasizing their close coordination. This reassurance follows an unscheduled meeting addressing rising tensions within the interim government, led by Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus since August 8, 2024. Yunus himself has attributed the current crisis to a "conspiracy" aimed at re-establishing Indian influence.

title: Microsoft engineer fired for disrupting CEO‚Äôs speech at Build 2025
content: Microsoft fired a software engineer, Joe Lopez, for disrupting CEO Satya Nadella's keynote at Build 2025, protesting the company's partnership with the Israeli military. Lopez accused Microsoft of complicity in harming Palestinians through its Azure cloud services.

title: 'Why was my life ruined?' Aishwarya Rai lashes out at Lalu family
content: Aishwarya Rai, Tej Pratap Yadav's ex-wife, has criticized Lalu Prasad Yadav's decision to disown his son after Tej Pratap's relationship confession. She questions why she was married into the family if they knew about his long-term relationship, accusing them of ruining her life and orchestrating a drama ahead of Bihar elections.

title: 'Waited 15 days for Pak to act against terror: PM on Op Sindoor
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, Prime Minister Modi asserted India's zero-tolerance stance on terrorism by initiating Operation Sindoor after waiting for Pakistan to act. The operation dismantled terror infrastructure, sending a strong message globally.

title: 'Koi bhi nahi sunn rha hai': Furious MS Dhoni loses cool
content: Gujarat Titans suffered a setback in their quest for a top-two IPL finish after losing to Chennai Super Kings, despite remaining at the top with 18 points. MS Dhoni's on-field frustration was evident as he reprimanded fielders during the game. Dhoni's future remains uncertain, as he plans to contemplate his IPL return after spending time in Ranchi.

title: Hardik Pandya hits unique 'triple century' in T20s
content: Hardik Pandya, the Mumbai Indians' all-rounder, is set to mark his 300th T20 appearance in a crucial match against Punjab Kings. With 5,512 runs and 203 wickets in his T20 career, Pandya's milestone coincides with a vital game where the winner gains a significant advantage in the IPL final race.

title: ITR filing FY25: What‚Äôs new this year? Things every taxpayer should know
content: ITR Filing FY 2024-25: The government has released the ITR forms for FY 2024-25, featuring updates related to capital gains, share buybacks, and MSME payments. Taxpayers must be aware of the increased threshold for asset and liability reporting.

title: 'No you can't just take it ... ': Shreyas Iyer's bold statement
content: At the Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur, Punjab Kings (PBKS) won the toss and chose to bowl first against Mumbai Indians (MI) in their IPL 2025 match. PBKS made two changes, bringing in Kyle Jamieson and Vijaykumar Vyshak. MI included Ashwani Kumar in their starting XI. Hardik Pandya mentioned that his team is treating every game like a knockout.

title: Watch: French prez slapped by wife on plane? Video sparks buzz
content: A video showing a brief interaction between French President Emmanuel Macron and his wife Brigitte upon arrival in Vietnam has sparked online speculation. The footage captures a moment where Brigitte's hand appears to touch Macron's face, followed by her declining his arm. Despite the controversy, Macron's team downplayed the incident as a lighthearted moment between the couple.

title: Sourav Ganguly's family escapes death by seconds
content: Snehasish Ganguly, Sourav Ganguly's brother, and his wife Arpita experienced a terrifying incident during a speedboat ride in Puri when a massive wave capsized their boat. Arpita recounted the near-death experience, emphasizing the crucial role of lifeguards in their rescue. Locals alleged that the speedboat was operated by untrained staff employed by a private adventure company.

title: Fake-ul-Bunyan: Pak PM gifts Asim Munir bogus photo of war with India
content: Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif gifted a framed photograph of a 2019 Chinese rocket artillery drill to Army Chief Gen. Asim Munir, falsely claiming it represented their military operation, "Bunyan-ul-Marsoos." This occurred while India executed Operation Sindoor, a precise retaliatory strike against terrorist infrastructure inside Pakistan following the Pahalgam attack, marking a significant escalation in India's response to cross-border terrorism.

title: 'Putin defending Russia': Kremlin reacts to Trump's 'crazy' comment
content: The Kremlin defended President Putin's actions in Ukraine, labeling recent strikes as "retaliatory," following criticism from Donald Trump, who called Putin "crazy" for the massive drone attacks. Ukraine reported a record 355 Russian drones launched overnight, causing damage to residential areas and injuring civilians. This escalation follows a weekend of intense Russian strikes, raising concerns about the ongoing conflict.

title: Bombay high court halts Mumbai airport's bid to replace Turkey's Celebi
content: In a relief to Turkish aviation firm Celebi, the Bombay High Court has intervened. The court directed Mumbai International Airport Limited (MIAL) to halt new contract awards. These contracts were for ground and bridge handling services. The legal battle arose after security clearance revocation for Celebi's Indian arm. The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security cited national security concerns.

title: 'Not written anywhere...': Virender Sehwag blasts KKR captain
content: Virender Sehwag criticized KKR captain Ajinkya Rahane for prioritizing his batting position over the team's needs after their elimination from the tournament. Rahane defended his decision, citing the team's winning combination and his success in the middle order. He acknowledged the team's batting struggles and vowed for a stronger comeback next season.

title: Rajasthan jailbirds found in hotels in Jaipur, 5 constables among 13 arrested
content: A shocking prison scandal has erupted in Rajasthan, with five inmates from Jaipur central jail, facing serious charges, caught enjoying unauthorized outings in city hotels. Allegedly, they bribed officials for medical leave and were escorted by complicit guards.

title: Chahal's rumoured girlfriend RJ Mahvash meets Preity Zinta
content: Mumbai Indians and Punjab Kings are set for a crucial clash in their final league match, both vying for a top-two finish in the IPL standings. Punjab Kings, currently second, need a win to stay in contention, while MI aims to capitalize on their net run rate. Meanwhile, RJ Mahvash shared her excitement after meeting Punjab Kings co-owner Preity Zinta.

title: Bharat Forecast System: India launches world's most precise weather model
content: India has launched the Bharat Forecasting System (BFS), a high-resolution weather model operating on a 6-kilometre grid, enhancing prediction capabilities. Powered by the new supercomputer Arka, the BFS delivers more accurate forecasts for disaster management, agriculture, and public safety. This system addresses the increasing impact of weather anomalies on India's economy and food inflation.

title: ‚ÄòMake in India‚Äô boost: Advanced version of BrahMos may be made in UP
content: India and Russia are in talks to manufacture an advanced BrahMos missile in Uttar Pradesh, following its successful deployment in Operation Sindoor against Pakistan. The new facility in UP, recently inaugurated, will be central to this large-scale production.

title: FIFA World Cup 2034: Saudi lifts 70-year alcohol ban in tourist zones
content: Saudi Arabia is set to partially lift its alcohol ban in 2026, a significant shift as it prepares for the 2034 FIFA World Cup. The move, part of Vision 2030, will allow alcohol sales in upscale venues like hotels and resorts. While spirits remain prohibited, beer, wine, and cider will be available under strict regulations.

title: Mumbai rain leaves Worli metro station flooded days after inauguration
content: Mumbai's newly inaugurated Worli underground station on the Aqua Line faced severe flooding due to torrential monsoon rains, disrupting metro services and forcing trains to operate only partially. The intense downpour, with Nariman Point recording 104 mm of rain in just one hour, caused widespread waterlogging, traffic gridlocks, and railway delays across the city.

title: 'They're 31% foreign and won't tell us who they are': Trump on Harvard row
content: Donald Trump defended his administration's attempt to block foreign students from Harvard, criticizing the university's demographics and funding. He claimed American taxpayers shouldn't subsidize the high number of foreign students and alleged antisemitism. This came after Homeland Security revoked Harvard's ability to enroll foreign nationals, a decision challenged in court and temporarily suspended by a judge.

title: SpaceX Dragon returns to Earth, triggers sonic boom in Southern California
content: Southern California residents heard a sonic boom on Saturday. It was caused by SpaceX Dragon spacecraft re-entering Earth's atmosphere. The spacecraft carried research and supplies from the International Space Station. Residents near Vandenberg Space Force Base were especially affected. Sonic booms are becoming more frequent due to increased SpaceX launches.

title: Covid cases rise in India: How new variants are different from previous ones
content: Currently, India has around 257 active COVID-19 cases spread across multiple states. Kerala has recorded the maximum number of cases, followed by Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Delhi Most cases remain mild and manageable at home. The government and health agencies are closely monitoring the situation and have issued advisories to vulnerable groups such as pregnant women, children, and people with other health conditions. (like cancer, heart disease etc)

title: Punjab's ‚ÄòInstagram Queen‚Äô head constable Amandeep Kaur arrested
content: Head constable Amandeep Kaur, previously arrested with heroin, now faces vigilance bureau scrutiny for allegedly possessing assets disproportionate to her income. Authorities valued her assets at approximately Rs 1.5 crore, including a house, vehicles, and luxury items. The vigilance bureau has registered a case against her and taken her into custody for further investigation into the source of her wealth.

title: 'Golf can be dangerous!': Trump shares bizarre image of 'attack' at Bedminster
content: Donald Trump shared a photo on Truth Social of a goose attacking someone at his Bedminster golf course, humorously commenting on the dangers of golf. The post quickly went viral, garnering significant attention and reactions online. In a separate post, Trump criticized Harvard's foreign student enrollment and funding, demanding transparency and questioning the financial contributions of these students' home countries.

title: 'What is he doing?': When Kamala fumed over Joe Biden donning a Trump hat
content: A new book reveals tensions within the 2024 Democratic campaign, sparked by ex-President Biden's controversial decision to wear a 'Trump 2024' hat. Former Vice President Harris reportedly expressed anger, deeming the act 'unhelpful'. The book also highlights Biden's criticism of Trump supporters, which Harris publicly distanced herself from. Furthermore, several of Biden's campaign videos were scrapped due to his poor performance, adding to the campaign's challenges.

title: 'It tried to drown me!': Kangaroo turns into boxer in showdown with Australian man
content: In New South Wales, Don James faced a kangaroo attack. The kangaroo chased James into floodwaters near Port Macquarie. Kristy Lees witnessed the incident. She saw the kangaroo and James in a boxing match. The kangaroo tried to drown James. It held him underwater. James escaped when the kangaroo got spooked. Lees helped James and alerted the community. James also survived a shark encounter previously.

title: Sourav Ganguly's brother, family narrowly escape as boat capsizes in Puri
content: The Puri district administration has launched an inquiry into a boat overturning incident involving Snehasish Ganguly, elder brother of Sourav Ganguly, and his family during water sports in Puri. Lifeguards rescued the family after the capsize.

title: Cat in custody: Kitty caught smuggling crack cocaine and weed into Costa Rican prison
content: In Costa Rica, prison guards intercepted a black-and-white cat attempting to smuggle drugs into Pococ√≠ prison. The feline was carrying over 230 grams of marijuana and 67 grams of crack cocaine taped to its body. Authorities believe the drugs were intended for inmates, and the cat has since been handed over to animal health services for care after its capture.

title: Syria: Returnees live in tents atop ruins
content: Syrian families, displaced near the Turkish border, hoped to return home after the ousting of Bashar Assad. However, they found their homes destroyed. Nadima al-Barakat lives in a tent on her home's rubble. Raed al-Hassan rebuilds brick by brick. Mohammed al-Raslan struggles with material costs. Hospitals and schools are ruined. Bilal Makhzoum seeks aid for reconstruction in Maarat al-Numan.

title: Road to the MCWS: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
content: the 2025 NCAA Division I baseball championship begins on friday . Vanderbilt, which just won the tournament, is the no. 1 overall seed . the rest of the top eight national seeds are Texas at No. 2, Arkansas at no. 3, Auburn at no . 4, North Carolina at no no. 5, LSU at no 6 and Oregon State at no 8 .

title: 'Dreams came true': Arsenal celebrate UWCL success
content: arsenal beat Barcelona 1-0 to win the women's champions league for the first time in 18 years . supporters gather in armoury square as early as 5 a.m. on monday to celebrate the end of an 18-year wait for a trophy . the victory parade did not start until after 10 .

title: Judge cash row: SC refuses to disclose in-house probe report
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Fever's Clark out at least 2 weeks for quad strain
content: caitlin Clark will be out at least two weeks with a left quad strain . she is averaging 19.0 points and a league-best 9.3 assists through four games this season . this marks the first regular-season games she will have missed in her young WNBA career .

title: Two-stop experiment doesn't fix F1's Monaco procession problem
content: formula 1's two-stop experiment at the Monaco Grand Prix underlines what the sport already knew about its most famous race . the confines of the circuit are too tight to allow genuine racing . it succeeded in providing a more dynamic race than the previous year, but with just one legal overtake in 78 laps, the fundamental issue with Monaco as an F1 venue was clear to see .

title: Liverpool prepare for Premier League title parade
content: the 15-kilometre route will be the same one used following the club's 2019 Champions League triumph . the parade will celebrate their carabao Cup and FA Cup victories in 2022 . fans lined the streets of the city to watch the parade in-person .

title: Final 2025 men's recruiting class rankings: 4 new teams, plus risers and fallers
content: the 2025 men's basketball recruiting class was missing star power in march . the last update in January saw multiple five-star prospects make commitments . a.J. Dybantsa and niko Bundalo traded buckets in the second quarter .

title: Oilers take control over Stars: Game 3 grades, takeaways
content: Connor McDavid and Zach Hyman each net two goals to power the Oilers to a 2-1 series lead vs. the Stars . losing Game 3 left them trailing a series for the second time this postseason . what does it mean for them to return home tied rather than a game away from elimination?

title: Macron reacts to viral video of wife slapping him, says it's...
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . read more 10 baby boy names that mean light 10 animals that can be spotted only in Europe 10 types of snakes found in India 8 best books that help become expert communicators and speakers 10 tips to make your home cooler and summer-proof during heatwaves 10 benefits of consuming warm milk before sleep Celebs who have done voiceover in animated films Avne

title: Villa VAR fury, Modric and Ancelotti, Napoli win Serie A

title: DMK, AIADMK to begin shortlisting their candidates soon for Rajya Sabha election
content: Given the strength of the two parties and their allies in the Assembly, four seats can be bagged by the DMK and the balance by the AIADMK

title: India embraces tourism, Pakistan sees 'terrorism as tourism', says Modi
content: Narendra Modi warned that if Pakistan's citizens do not choose peace, they would face the wrath of the Indian Army

title: India pushing back ‚Äòillegal‚Äô immigrants to Bangladesh
content: The migrants included women and children who were detained by the Delhi Police from outer Delhi last week during a drive to identify illegal immigrants

title: Maoist leader cremated in Narayanpur amidst family‚Äôs demand to return him to his village in Andhra Pradesh
content: The police said that there had been ‚Äòno legal claimant‚Äô for the seven bodies, including that of top Maoist leader Basavaraju

title: Mumbai breaks record, receives highest rainfall in May
content: Colaba Coastal Observatory recorded the highest rainfall this May at 300 mm, breaking the record from 1918 of 279.4 mm

title: Kerala govt. to crack down on teachers, staff involved in POCSO cases: Minister
content: 77 POCSO cases reported so far against those working in secondary schools. 3 POCSO cases reported in vocational higher secondary division

title: Bar district administration, civic volunteers from Bengal poll process: BJP
content: Suvendu Adhikari said that fair elections are a prerequisite to democracy in West Bengal and urged the Chief Electoral Officer to change the Standard Operating Procedure

title: Bareilly police begin 15-day drive to identify Rohingya and Bangladeshi migrants
content: The move follows ‚Äòinsturctions from the administration,‚Äô as the police have been ordered to focus on temporary shanties, and detain suspects as per MHA guidelines

title: Maldives extends ‚Äòfirm support‚Äô to India in fight against terrorism
content: Maldives Foreign Minister Abdulla Khaleel appreciated the recent emergency financial assistance from India; he held a bilateral meeting with External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar

title: Rain wreaks havoc in Kozhikode
content: Around 60 houses damaged in different parts of the district; three relief camps opened; 88 people shifted to camps

title: Court accepts closure report to cancel sexual harassment case against Brij Bhushan
content: The police had recommended the cancellation of the complaint involving the minor wrestler, saying ‚Äúno corroborative evidence‚Äù was found

title: Desecration of Ajit Jogi‚Äôs statue days before inauguration sparks row
content: The late leader‚Äôs son, MLA Amit Jogi, and supporters stage protest, demand reinstallation of statue in the same spot

title: University of Liverpool to open campus in Bengaluru; admission from next year
content: The inaugural cohort of undergraduate and postgraduate students will join the university in August 2026, initially offering programmes in business management, accounting and finance, computer science, and biomedical sciences

title: Nitish Kumar courts controversy for placing flower pot IAS officer‚Äôs head
content: People present at the occasion were surprised to see the Bihar CM treating a senior IAS officer in such a manner

title: Bharat Forecast System set to give sharper rain alerts
content: Bharat Forecast System has shown ‚Äònotable improvements‚Äô since 2002, said the Ministry of Earth Sciences; the latest version can provide short to medium term forecasts that are given over a span of three to seven days

title: Aishwarya Rai, ex-wife of Tej Pratap, terms Lalu‚Äôs action against his son a ‚Äòdrama‚Äô
content: Ms. Rai alleged when Lalu‚Äôs family members were aware that Tej Pratap was in relation with another woman then why did they get her marry and ruin her life

title: Centre‚Äôs reform nudge to States resulting in less land wastage, increased digitisation
content: According to data shared by the Finance Ministry, 22 states have carried out reforms in building bye laws for industrial and commercial plots. Of these, 18 States have reduced land wastage in factory plots due to outdated setbacks and parking regulations to less than 30%

title: From Pahalgam and Gulmarg, Omar Abdullah to make bid to woo¬†tourists to Kashmir
content: The Chief Minister will chair a tourism stakeholders meeting, show the return of normalcy to prospective tourists

title: RTI reveals ‚Çπ12.97 lakh foreign trip by panel for Bengaluru metro fare hike, but exposes gap in transparency on report
content: The fare hike, which came into effect on February 9, was the first revision in over seven years, and has since made Namma Metro the most expensive metro transit system in India among major cities.¬†

title: Manipur Governor avoids protestors, travels 7 km in chopper
content: The protestors had formed a human chain on the road to the airport, where he landed from New Delhi after attending the Rising Northeast Investors Summit

title: The Hindu wins in content, marketing and green initiatives at Abby Awards 2025
content: The Group‚Äôs city campaign ‚ÄòMade of Chennai‚Äô won silver award for ‚ÄòBest Marketing of a Printed Newspaper/Edition‚Äô under the Publisher Abby category. The campaign successfully deepened local engagement, celebrating the spirit, stories, and people of Chennai through print and on-ground activities

title: Crack on under-construction overbridge along NH 66 at Manathala in Thrissur sparks outrage
content: Serious safety concerns arise from a 50m crack on an under-construction overbridge, triggering public outrage and official investigations.

title: Kaleshwaram soaks in spiritual fervour as the 12-day Saraswati Pushkaralu draws to a close
content: An estimated 30 lakh pilgrims took a holy dip at Triveni Sangamam  in Kaleshwaram during the mega religious fete from May 15 to 26, officials said

title: TPCC to have a jumbo executive committee with over 100 office bearers; Revanth and Mahesh to meet high command on Cabinet expansion on May 30
content: Much-anticipated State Cabinet expansion has been pushed by at least a week as deliberations on the induction of more Ministers could not be held on Monday as AICC chief Mallikarjun Kharge was not present in New Delhi

title: 11 COVID-19 cases in West Bengal; health workers say no need to panic but¬†urge caution
content: While overall national caseload remains low, medical experts warned against complacency in urban areas like Kolkata, and urged adherence to hygiene protocols and full vaccination.

title: Street vendors knock on GHMC‚Äôs door against harassment
content: Pushcart vendors say Operation ROPE (Removal of Obstructive Parking & Encroachments) by the Traffic Police has majorly impacted their livelihood

title: Optimistic about achieving 10-12% credit growth for FY26: Indian Bank MD Binod Kumar
content: ‚ÄòThe two interest rate cuts by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and also expectations of further cuts is likely to spur credit demand‚Äô

title: Three electrocuted in Srikakulam
content: A few families had brought decorative lights from Berahampur and installed them without taking proper safety precautions; the drizzle and gales caused the wires to snap, leading to the accident

title: Court sends YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra to judicial custody in espionage case
content: Data from the Hisar-based travel vlogger‚Äôs three mobile phones and a laptop, which had been sent for forensic examination, has been recovered, police sources said on May 26

title: The future is electric, once again
content: They were quite the rage more than 100 years ago in the early 1900s, with EVs constituting over a third of all vehicles sold in the United States.

title: PM to visit poll-bound Bihar again on May 29 and 30
content: On his third visit this year to Bihar, where the Assembly election due in October-November, the PM will inaugurate Patna airport‚Äôs integrated terminal building, hold a roadshow in the State capital, and address a public rally at Rohtas

title: Kerala govt. sounds high alert along coastline following oil spill, threat of chemical leakage from capsized ship
content: Government classifies accident as a Tier 2 maritime event. Public asked to report the sighting of containers by dialling 112 and maintain a minimum distance of 200 m from them¬†¬†

title: Anvar opposes Shoukath‚Äôs candidacy in Nilambur

title: Andhra Pradesh government is planning to increase house tax in urban areas, says CPI(M)
content: The municipal authorities have launched surveys in 123 towns and cities across the State, covering 40.22 lakh households and other buildings, says the party State secretariat member

title: COVID-19 precaution: Karnataka asks schools to give leave for students with cold and fever
content: The high level meeting on COVID chaired by the CM advises parents not to send children with cold and fever to school

title: Supreme Court Collegium recommends new Chief Justices for five High Courts
content: The High Courts of Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka, Gauhati, Patna and Jharkhand will get new Chief Justices if the government approves the recommendations. Karnataka Chief Justice N.V. Anjaria and Gauhati Chief Justice Vijay Bishnoi have been recommended to appointment as judges in the Supreme Court

title: Alappuzha on alert after ship containers wash ashore
content: Two containers from the capsized MSC ELSA 3 washes up at Tharayilkadavu near Arattupuzha on Monday; is said to contain cotton materials

title: Service roads between Hebbal and Silk Board to be merged with ORR till metro construction is over
content: The decision comes in the wake of metro construction occupying significant portions of road space and disrupting vehicular movement

title: YouTubers complain after newswire agency ANI demands licence fee
